intro: Ipomopsis spicata var. robruthiae, commonly known as Robruth's spicatopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as grasslands and slopes. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
